moves.4. Qxd4: Nxd4 is more common.  This is the Boden variation.
moves.7. Nc3 Nf6 8. Bg5 Be7 9. O-O-O h6 10. Bf: Queen threatens both Ra1 and Nh5.  Black protects the knight by picking off the h pawn.
moves.22... Qxa2: ...or not.  Black is going to end up with six pawns against white's three, but a blunder throws white the game.
moves.23. Qxa8+ Kg7 24. Qf3: The knight remains unprotected.  But black can push around the white king while molesting pawns.
moves.24... Qxb2+ 25. Kd2 Qd4+ 26. Ke1 Nxf4: Qb4 might have bought more time, but rook and bishop for queen isn't a terrible trade.  Rook and bishop for queen and knight however is not so hot.
moves.27. Rxd4 Bxd4 28. Qxf4: 28. Qxf4 Bc3+ buys black a move, but promoting the passed a pawn is probably not in the cards given white's queen and rook.
